feed.title: SAP Community - SD (Sales and Distribution)
feed.subtitle: SD (Sales and Distribution) Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Customer Hierarchy as Mandatory partner in Sales order header
entry.content:
Hi Gurus, 

We would like to have customer hierarchy as Mandatory partner in sales order header but we can't set it in header partner determination procedure with Mandatory partner checkbox. Can you help me with ways to achieve it ?

entry.title: How to Make Attachment Mandatory Before Saving in VA01 (Sales Order Creation)?
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

One of my clients has a requirement to make it mandatory to attach a document before saving a sales order in VA01 and VA02.

I successfully implemented the check in VA02 by using the USEREXIT_SAVE_DOCUMENT_PREPARE in MV45AFZZ, where the sales order number is already available, and I could restrict the save based on the attachment check.

However, in VA01, since the sales order number is generated only after saving, I'm unable to validate whether an attachment is present before the document is saved.

Has anyone faced a similar scenario?
Is there a way to check for attachments or enforce this validation in VA01 before the sales order is created?
Any BADI or User Exit suggestions or workaround approaches would be highly appreciated.

Thanks in advance!

Best regards,

Mannem Leelamohan

entry.title: Avoid creation of duplicate condition contract
entry.content:
Dear Expert,

We are using SAP S/4  HANA-2023 on premise. system is allowing to create duplicate condition contract (for same customer, same validity period & same conditions). there is no duplicate entry check if there is an identical condition contract.

Can you please check what configuration is required to avoid creation of duplicate condition contract?

Thank you,

Rahul

entry.title: Long street name issue during customer master load/update via LSMW
entry.content:
Dears,
I need to update quite a lot of customer records by adding a long street name (up to 60 characters). However, I'm running into an issue when using LSMW.

In VD02 transaction, SAP allows entering a street name up to 60 characters. But in the LSMW recording, only 35 characters are available in the street field (including the building number). The screen layout during recording also looks slightly different from what I see in VD02 – see the screenshot attached. I’ve observed a similar issue when trying to use direct input (object 0050 / program RFBIDE00).

I understand that the KNA1-STRAS field is limited to 35 characters, but still, I need to load longer street names (like in VD02) for around 100 customers. It's SAP ECC 6.0.

Is there a way to handle this using LSMW?

Regards
Krzysztof

entry.title: No customer master record exists for sold-to party - Message No. VP199 - No customer master in KNVV
entry.content:
Tried creating a sales order and getting this issue.

Have maintained the below configurations.
Cross-Application Components - SAP Business Partner - Business Partner - Basic Settings - Business Partner Roles - Define BP Roles

Cross-Application Components - SAP Business Partner - Business Partner - Basic Settings - Number Ranges and Groupings - Define Groupings and Assign Number Ranges

Financial Accounting - Accounts Receivable and Accounts Payable - Customer Accounts - Master Data - Preparations for Creating Customer Master Data - Define Account Groups with Screen Layout (Customers)

Financial Accounting - Accounts Receivable and Accounts Payable - Customer Accounts - Master Data - Preparations for Creating Customer Master Data - Assign Number Ranges to Customer Account Groups

Master Data Synchronization - Customer/Vendor Integration - Business Partner Settings - Settings for Customer Integration - 
Field Assignment for Customer Integration - Assign Keys - Define Number Assignment for Direction BP to Customer

in VOPA assigned the AG to all SP, SH, PY, BP.

AG updated in BP. Customer number generated in BP

Customer displaying in VA01 search box but still error.

But still getting issue in va01. Checked online got no answer. since asking
At last the customer data is not available in KNVV and KNVP table. Am I missing any

entry.title: Default Loading Group in Material Master to Prevent Shipping Point Error
entry.content:
We are encountering the following SAP SD error during sales order processing:

Ship.condition 01 loading grp plant MY18 StLoc FG91 not defined (V1358)

This happens when the Loading Group (LOSGR) is missing or not maintained in the material master, causing shipping point determination to fail.

Is there a way to default the Loading Group value (e.g., '0001') automatically in the material master when it is not maintained, either through configuration or enhancement (user exit/BADI)?

  • If yes, what is the recommended approach to ensure all new and existing materials have a valid Loading Group to prevent this error?

  • If this requires an ABAP enhancement, could you please advise on the recommended user exit or BADI to use for auto-populating the Loading Group during material creation or change?

entry.title: Pricing - Condition activate with requirements
entry.content: I wrote a requirement on pricing to activate or deactivate a price condition. At the moment when the requirement sets the sy-subrc = 0, the condition does not trigger automatically and a repricing is needed. How can I resolve this? All of this in the sales order.

entry.title: Where are exchange rates actually used in business processes (FI, MM, SD)?
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I’ve successfully configured the automatic exchange rate import via the MRM module.
Now I’m trying to better understand where exactly these rates are applied in real business processes.

I’m aware that FI, MM, and SD (and possibly other modules) are impacted.
However, I’m still looking for concrete use cases or documentation that describe how and where the exchange rate is used – for example, in sales documents, purchase orders, or billing. I’d like to include a clear use case for all Moduls in our group-wide rollout showing where exchange rates impact business processes in SAP.

Is there a clear overview, real-life example, or detailed explanation of which transactions or document types rely on exchange rates?

Thanks a lot in advance and best regards,
Simon

entry.title: Modify Layout for VA01-VA21-VF01
entry.content:
I want to modify the layout of the columns from VA01-VA21-VF01. I tried to access the layout modification and set the 'invisible' flag for the columns I wanted to hide. However, when I activate them, they do not appear in the base parameterization layout... is this correct?Do I have to create my own layout? How can I then make it the default for all users (without them having to create it themselves)?

 

Thank you.

entry.title: Sale price record VK11 upto 5 decimals
entry.content:
Hello Everyone, As per SAP standards, the system allows up to 2 decimals in the price record, but our requirement is to have up to 5 decimals. For such cases, SAP’s recommendation is to maintain the record using units like per 10PC, 100PC, etc. However, we have encountered situations where human errors in performing these calculations have resulted in significant revenue discrepancies. Hence, I would like to understand if we have any SAP recommendation.

Proposed a solution to have additional columns in standard mass sales price app where you will enter price upto 5 digits and system does automatic calculation to put upto 2 decimals (attached PP for your reference).

we also thought of duplicating and creating new custom currency type that allows more decimal places. But we have already gone live with 3 sites and implementing this would cause inconsistencies.

entry.title: S4 Manage Characteristic Catalogs for SUP
entry.content:
Hi

we are trying to include the standard Sales order header VBAK fields into the Manage Characteristic Catalogs app for Supply Protection context. Only very limited list of order header fields are coming up for selection to define the horizon.  Is this a limitation of the app?  We want to bring in more fields from standard VBAK and not custom fields

entry.title: Need help for Transaction O4F1 Exits
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I need User Exits or an enhancement where I can edit the data for Bulk Shipment Document items and Bulk Shipment  Stage items fields located in the Stages and Maintain stages tabs before or after saving.

I’d appreciate any recommendations. Thank you!

entry.title: S4 Public cloud - schedule billing creation
entry.content:
Hi,

We have requirement to create billing document for current and past billing date in SO header. Billing should be created for billing block released documents only if it is current or past billing dates and not for future dates. We have added parameter as "start date - X days" in billing date field. still future dated billing documents are getting created. 

Kindly suggest to solve this issue. 

Regards,

Rajesh

entry.title: Product Substition in EWM for Kit to Order Scenario
entry.content:
Hello,

I would like to know how can we configure and perform product substitution in EWM. 

Scenario - we are having sales bom and if few components are not available then would like to substitute with others from EWM. Please provide some lights if it's possible and if yes then how to achieve it or other possible solutions.

Note: I will be using product substitution with Kit-to-order scenario where I will have specific item category for components already.

Thanks,

entry.title: Duplicate Invoices generated.
entry.content:
During certain time period few duplicate invoices are generated for commercial invoice and Intercompany invoice.

Trying to identify the root cause, as the invoices are created with Job could not find any specific reason.

Tried checking all notes i dont get any help with those.

Please can anyone suggest how to deal with it.

Note: With in duplicates for one of the invoice accounting document got genera

entry.title: send sales order from a particular plant into backorder post noon trigger plant substitution
entry.content:
We have a requirement to send sales order from a particular plant into backorder post noon. Due to manpower shortage one of the plant will not be taking new orders post noon and only be working on shipping already confirmed deliveries. We have placed a plant substitution to replace the closed plant on the newly created orders post noon. How do we impact the initial ATP check, to not confirm order on the closed plant and go for substitution instead. 

As per aATP the substitution works only when the initial ATP does not confirm quantity.

entry.title: Growth Rebate in Condition Contract
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

We wants to reward our customers that grow their purchase value by more than 15% YoY. Rebates are only applicable if current-year sales exceed base year by a defined percentage.

 For e.g -   Base year: 2024 - Target year: 2025 - Incentive: 5% rebate on incremental sales exceeding 15% growth

Does this scenario us possible in standard CCM S/4 HANA 2023 ? if yes How? 

Thank You

entry.title: Double authorization while creating a sales order
entry.content:
Hi Team,

We have implemented the DPA for our receivable payment and integrated with PSP (Snap pay & Cyber source).

When customer create an order on ourwebsite, we are already taking the authorization on credit card and when order is passed into SAP, using iDoc and order get created, SAP Standard order process is taking the authorization again. What is the standard process to avoid the duplicate authorization. How can we bypass the authorization process during creation time using iDoc.


--- Steps to Reproduce ---

  1. Pick an iDoc (Idoc # 0000000002417081) using transaction WE19 
  2. Go to segment E1EDK02 and change the sales order number to a new number which is not available in the system
  3. and click on Standard Inbound 
  4. This will trigger the sales order creation, and you can see that the SAP is taking the authorization again, but we already had the card authorization when iDoc comes in SAP

entry.title: Rounding error in sales order
entry.content:
Hello everyone:
I have a problem with the sales order. My example is as follows:
I have an order with 7 items, the price condition is entered manually, and the total value is entered in the header.
The problem is that the total value doesn't match the customer's value. Where the items are rounded by decimals, the total value obtained is 329,492.67, and the customer's calculated value is 329,492.677. Therefore, it must be rounded to 329,492.68.
How can I adjust this value so that it calculates correctly, leaving that difference in cents in the item with the largest amount. As additional information, I cannot modify the company code currency.

entry.title: value for withholding tax (TDS) for customer against sales order is not reflecting in F-28 Payments
entry.content:
Dear SAP Experts,

I am facing an issue regarding withholding tax for customer through sales order.

The value of withholding tax is not fetching inF-28 withholding tax tab & system is showing zero as the value of withholding tax for Document type -RV.

I have successfully executed withholding tax for customer process from FI side but I am unable to process from sales.

Help me in resolving the issue

Regards,
Vaishnavi
